p: Mexican oregano, Lippia berlandieri Schauer, essential oil (MOO) is characterized by its strong odor and different biological activities, and the plant yields high quantities of essential oils (Avila‐Sosa, Gastélum‐Franco, Camacho‐Dávila, Torres‐Muñoz, & Nevárez‐Moorillón, 2010; Dunford & Vazquez, 2005). The main MOO constituents consist of carvacrol, thymol, β‐myrcene, α‐terpinene, ɤ‐terpinene, p‐cymene, and ceneol; components with antibacterial, antioxidant, antiviral, antifungal, and insecticidal properties (Ortega‐Nieblas et al., 2011; Silva‐Vazquez et al., 2017; Vazquez & Dunford, 2005).
